result.execSummary:
The defendant Christopher Jay Lawrence was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • Contact after Domestic Abuse Arrest [Modifiers: Domestic Abuse Assessments], an unclassified misdemeanor, Wisconsin Statutes 968.075(5)(a)1.
  • Bail Jumping-Misdemeanor [Modifiers: Domestic Abuse Assessments], a class A misdemeanor, Wisconsin Statutes 946.49(1)(a).
  • Disorderly Conduct [Modifiers: Domestic Abuse Assessments], a class B misdemeanor, Wisconsin Statutes 947.01(1).

Charge(s) in this case were read in to this or other case(s). A "read in" charge is a charge that is dismissed as part of a plea agreement, however:

  • The defendant agrees to have the court consider the charge(s) when sentencing for another crime, under Wis. Stats. 973.20(1g)(b); and
  • The defendant cannot be prosecuted for these charge(s) in the future.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

supervisions.notes:
Court ordered defendant to sign up for probation no later than 4:00 pm on 10/27/22.
Probation review hearing scheduled in Branch 29.

miscConds.notes: Court advised defendant due to this DV conviction he may never possess firearms or ammunition.

Complete batterer's intervention program.
Attend treatment and/or counseling as determined.
Mental health evaluation; take all prescribed medications.
Follow DV injunction in 22FA3659 exactly as written.

No contact with victim unless approved by the court.
No contact with firearms.

Provide a DNA sample.
DV assessment imposed.
Defendant to pay all applicable costs, assessments and surcharges, including the DV and DNA surcharges during the period of probation. Failure to pay the costs and surcharges will result in a civil judgment. Any cash bail on deposit to apply and the remaining balance to be returned to the poster.
Court set restitution at zero.

result.caption: State of Wisconsin vs. Christopher Jay Lawrence

records.addlTxt:
Defendant Christopher Jay Lawrence appeared by video, in custody.  Attorney Awni M Yasin appeared by video for Christopher Jay Lawrence.  Prosecuting attorney Tristan J. Bednarek appeared by video for the State of Wisconsin. 
Plea and sentencing hearing held. Court held colloquy with the defendant regarding his right to have an in-person hearing. Parties have reached an agreement. State places offer on the record. Defense and defendant are in agreement.

Pursuant to negotiations and on the Motion of the State, Court Ordered Counts 1, 2, and 6 DISMISSED BUT READ IN for the purpose of sentencing.

AS TO COUNTS 3, 4, AND 5: Defendant changes plea(s) to GUILTY. Defendant examined as to plea, advised of Constitutional Rights and the maximum penalties. Defendant further advised that if not a US citizen, deportation is possible. Court found that the defendant knowingly, voluntarily and intelligently waived rights.  Plea Questionnaire/Waiver of Rights form, Addendum, and Elements/Jury Instructions received and filed. Parties stipulate to the Criminal Complaint as a factual basis to sustain defendant's plea(s).  Court found defendant GUILTY and ordered a Judgment of Conviction be entered on the record.  

Parties prepared to proceed with sentencing. State advised the Court they have complied with the Victims' Rights Law. Statements by each counsel and defendant as to sentencing.

AS TO COUNT 3: Court sentenced the defendant to serve 6 MONTHS in the House of Correction, consecutive.
Court STAYED the sentence and placed the defendant on probation for 18 MONTHS.

AS TO COUNT 4: Court sentenced the defendant to serve 6 MONTHS in the House of Correction, consecutive.
Court STAYED the sentence and placed the defendant on probation for 18 MONTHS.

AS TO COUNT 5: Court sentenced the defendant to serve 6 DAYS in the House of Correction, consecutive, with credit for 6 DAYS time served. A TIME SERVED DISPOSITION.

CONDITIONS OF PROBATION:
- Serve 90 days condition time in the House of Correction; STAYED pending review, as to each count 3 and to count 4.
- Complete batterer's intervention program.
- Attend treatment and/or counseling as determined.
- Mental health evaluation; take all prescribed medications.
- No contact with victim unless approved by the court.
- Follow DV injunction in 22FA3659 exactly as written.
- Obtain/maintain employment.
- No contact with firearms.
- Provide a DNA sample.
- DV assessment imposed.
- Defendant to pay all applicable costs, assessments and surcharges, including the DV and DNA surcharges during the period of probation. Failure to pay the costs and surcharges will result in a civil judgment. Any cash bail on deposit to apply and the remaining balance to be returned to the poster.
- Court set restitution at zero.

*Court advised defendant of appellant rights. 
*Court advised defendant due to this DV conviction he may never possess firearms or ammunition.
*Court ordered defendant to sign up for probation no later than 4:00 pm on 10/27/22.

Defendant Christopher Jay Lawrence in court.  Tristan J. Bednarek appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  
Case set for a pre-trial conference. Court conducted Indigency Hearing. Court held colloquy with defendant. Court found defendant is eligible for appointment of counsel by court. Defendant requested court appointed counsel and agreed to reimburse Milwaukee County for the expense. The court appointed Atty. Awni Yasin to represent defendant in this matter at County expense and at the rate of $100.00 per hour. The court ordered the defendant repay the County at a rate of $50.00 per month beginning at the completion of the case, and then the 1st of each month there after. Court advised defendant failure to pay will result in a civil judgment. Signed, Distributed & Filed, Order Appointing Attorney at County Expense. Case is adjourned to Br. 29.  Status conference scheduled for September 6, 2022 at 08:30 am.
